message.content:
In LibreOffice Calc, you can use a combination of SUBSTITUTE and CHAR functions to achieve this task. 

Assuming the content with single quotes is in cell A1, you can write the following expression in another cell:

```
=SUBSTITUTE(A1,CHAR(39),"")
```

This expression does the following:
- `CHAR(39)` generates a single quote character.
- `SUBSTITUTE` function replaces all occurrences of the specified character (in this case, the single quote) in the text with another specified character (in this case, no character, which effectively removes it). 

The result of the expression will be the content from cell A1 without any single quotes.
